intro: Moehringia muscosa var. catalaunica, commonly known as the Catalaunian moehringia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are typically rounded or ovate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland or rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in early spring.
